content.description: Create your application logic with the help of our AI driven Peakbot.
Draw directly into your Peakboard applications.
New datasource to connect BACnet devices.
New possibility to analyse and debug applications.

list_items: Adjusted device ID check when setting a new license key, enhancing the validation process for device IDs.
Allowed setting of default sound devices in the Box management dialog.
Enhanced Box Management with rearranged properties in the general tab and added subheads for better organization.
Fixed the issue where hostname checks work differently on runtime compared to Designer.
Optimized Swagger example calls for improved communication.
Added a checkbox to prefer Hub communication over LAN communication in communication settings.
Fixed the error where it was previously not possible to change the timeserver/timezone for a box connected via the cloud.
Resolved the issue where the Peakboard Box logs were not translated, and the header was cut in German.
Reimplemented Extensions with Pipes to facilitate the upgrade to .NET 8.
Updated to allow specific values for number/string parameters to be displayed as a dropdown instead of a textbox.
Included version details in the extension dialog and restricted updates to cases where the current version is lower than the online version.
Added a warning message if an extension is not installed when opening a project that requires it.
Variables now copy their constraints from the Hub, ensuring consistent data management.
Updated the Variable List Dialog to accommodate constraints and default values.
Continued improvement on Hub Flows with several enhancements, including removing old scripts and setting data source and Dataflow states to manual by default.
Allowed the listing of Load triggers with MQTT and OPC UA options.
Enhanced Upload with a prompt for a name if no file name is given.
Fixed issue with merging the box Peakboard Hub snippets and removed unnecessary connection Hub functions.
Improved the error message when uploading a Hub Flow to the Hub online, clarifying license needs.
Replaced sources dialog in Dataflows with a simple text display for trigger sources.
Implemented validation for column names in the Rename Column Step of Dataflow, aligning with variable lists.
Fixed a bug where group aggregation on a column named 'Parent' failed in DevMaster but worked in Release.
Improved the user interface for SharePoint Lists.
Implemented info boxes in various dialogs for user guidance.
Implemented drag-and-drop functionality improvements in the Explorer.
Enhanced multi-line usage for cut titles to improve readability.
Resolved issues where the update feature and scrolling bars were malfunctioning.
Addressed multiple bugs relating to link clicking, script renaming, and other UI behaviors.
Added properties for Conditional Formatting in Styled Lists/Tiles, including options to hide, change background color, width, and height.
Enabled CF connection to data outside the list bound to the Styled Lists/Tiles.
Fixed various bugs in Conditional Formatting, including the CF triggering and hotkey issues.
Introduced the capability to save status code and error text in local variables for the HTTP block.
Added multiple features to Building Blocks: new comment blocks, return types, and enhanced regex support.
Ensure that the QuickWrap and QuickAdd buttons display correctly.
Incorporated various new actions and functions within the Snippets: Get Proxy LUA functions, error handling, and input refresh enhancements.
Addressed a variety of bugs related to snippet operations and Building Block functionality.
Implemented a new AI integration for enhanced scripting within Building Blocks.
Revamped contexts, updating icons and buttons to improve usability.
Expanded debugging panel functionalities in the runtime, offering better visibility and control.
Resolved bugs related to QuickWrap and local variable search functions
Implemented a new Hub Files Data source, enabling users to access file names and paths within a selected folder.
Improved license verification upon Hub connection changes, ensuring optimal flow project functionality.
Enhanced support for non-generic lists in SharePoint, broadening data flexibility.
Resolved issues with adding rows to SharePoint Lists through Snippets, addressing challenges with empty lists or columns.
Fixed the drag-and-drop issues within subfolders under Resources for seamless file management.
Resolved an error where certain links and buttons were not responding as intended.
Add extended data source capabilities, including the addition of channel message reply counts.
Rectified errors occurring when retrieving messages from application bots instead of users.
Implemented Hub Files Data source for navigating name and paths of files in a folder within Hub Files.
Enabled license re-checks upon Hub connection updates, ensuring smooth Hub Flows.
Implemented a debug panel in the Peakboard Runtime to improve data source management and script execution during debugging.
Resolved various bugs and enhanced script management functions for improved usability.
Added a clear input snippet for clearing current inputs in the text input control.
Introduced a return type function within Building Blocks to enhance clarity.
Enabled additional scripting functions within shared calendars, offering greater contextual support.
Enabled new script selection dialogues for improved user engagement.
